input.description: The name of the actor adapter. Default: CASDActor

This wrapper retrieves incident records in the Service Desk system.
Sample Item XML:
<items> <item> <target> <soap-url>https://172.16.1.1:8443/axis/services/USD_R11_WebService?wsdl</soap-url> <host>172.16.1.1</host> <user-name>ServiceDesk</user-name> <password>password</password> <port>8443</port> <protocol>https</protocol> <allow-unsigned-certificate>true</allow-unsigned-certificate> <install-certificate>true</install-certificate> <passphrase>changeit</passphrase> </target> <incident-number>110</incident-number> <assignee>ServiceDesk</assignee> <group>Test Group</group> <status>open</status> <priority>1</priority> <is-active>true</is-active> <incident-area>Add.IT.Other</incident-area> <configuration-item>CI</configuration-item> <reported-by>ServiceDesk</reported-by> <affected-end-user>ServiceDesk</affected-end-user> <affected-end-user-id>ServiceDesk</affected-end-user-id> <affected-end-user-location>US</affected-end-user-location> <affected-end-user-organization>BMC</affected-end-user-organization> <summary>Summary</summary> <description>Description</description> <problem>100</problem> <change>50</change> <caused-by-change-order>100</caused-by-change-order> <incident-priority>2</incident-priority> <impact>1-entire organization</impact> <urgency>1-As Possible</urgency> <severity>1-Escalated</severity> <earliest-open-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</earliest-open-date> <latest-open-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</latest-open-date> <earliest-close-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</earliest-close-date> <latest-close-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</latest-close-date> <parent>22</parent> <earliest-resolve-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</earliest-resolve-date> <latest-resolve-date>09/20/2011 04:54 pm</latest-resolve-date> <is-child>true</is-child> <root-cause>rootcause</root-cause> <sla-violation>false</sla-violation> <is-template>true</is-template> <number-of-records>-1</number-of-records> <additional-search-arguments>close_date>12345678</additional-search-arguments> </item> </items>
Parameter Description:
items[Required] The parent tag that contains item details
item[Required] This tag contains the input data for individual item
target[Conditional] This tag contains the dynamic target configuration details for every item. This is required if adapter configuration is left empty.
soap-url[Optional] CA Service Desk web service SOAP url. Either "soap-url" or "host" should be specified for a valid dynamic target configuration. If both are provided "soap-url" takes precedence. Sample url format: https://<hostname>:<port>/axis/services/USD_R11_WebService?wsdl
host[Optional] Hostname or IP Address of server where CA Service Desk is installed. Either "soap-url" or "host" should be specified for a valid dynamic target configuration. If both are provided "soap-url" takes precedence.
user-name[Optional] User name required for authentication.
password[Optional] Password required for authentication.
port[Optional] Communication port for CA Service Desk application. Valid values - Any positive number greater than 0. Default value - 8080 for http, 8443 for https.
protocol[Optional] Communication protocol for CA Service Desk application. Valid values - http, https. Default value - https
install-certificate[Optional] Specifies if installation of certificates is desired. Valid values - true, false. Default value - false
allow-unsigned-certificate[Optional] Specifies if unsigned certificates need to be allowed. Valid values - true, false. Default value - false
passphrase[Optional] Password for authentication with the SSL certificate on the target server. Default value - changeit
incident-number[Optional] Number of the incident to be retrieved. Valid values - Valid incident number.
assignee[Optional] Contact name to whom the incident is assigned. Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
group[Optional] Group to which incident record is assigned. Valid values - Valid group name
status[Optional] Status of the incident record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
priority[Optional] Priority associated with the incident record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization to the default list of values is also supported.
is-active[Optional] Specifies whether the incident is active. Valid values - true, false
incident-area[Optional] Category associated with the incident. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization done to the default list are also supported.
configuration-item[Optional] Configuration item associated with the incident record. Valid values - Valid configuration item name.
reported-by[Optional] Name of the contact who reported the incident. Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
affected-end-user[Optional] Affected end user for the incident record. Valid values - Valid name in the format - Last Name,First Name,Middle Name. Some Examples: If last name, first name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,first name,middle name If only last name exists then value wil be - last name If last name and middle name exists then value will be - last name,,middle name
affected-end-user-id[Optional] User id of the affected end user for the incident record. Valid values - Valid user id of affected end user
affected-end-user-location[Optional] Location of the affected end user for the incident record. Valid values - Valid location of affected end user
affected-end-user-organization[Optional] Organization of the affected end user for the incident record. Valid values - Valid organization of affected end user
summary[Optional] Summary associated with the incident record. Valid values - Any String value
description[Optional] Description associated with the incident record. Valid values - Any String value
problem[Optional] Problem associated with the incident record. Valid values - Valid problem number
change[Optional] Change attached to the incident record. Valid values - Valid change number
caused-by-change-order[Optional] Change order which caused the incident. Valid values - Valid change number
incident-priority[Optional] Incident priority associated with the incident. Valid values - Valid incident priority
impact[Optional] Impact associated with this incident record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization done to the default list are also supported.
urgency[Optional] Urgency associated with this incident record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization done to the default list are also supported.
severity[Optional] Severity associated with this incident record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization done to the default list are also supported.
earliest-open-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all incident records with open-date greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
latest-open-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all incident records with open-date less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
earliest-resolve-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all incident records with resolve-date greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
latest-resolve-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all incident records with resolve-date less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
earliest-close-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all incident records with close-date greater than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
latest-close-date[Optional] If this value is provided then all incident records with close-date less than or equal to this value will be retrieved. Valid values - DateTime in the format mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm am/pm. For example - 10/04/2011 09:27 pm
parent[Optional] Parent incident associated with the incident record. Valid values - Valid incident number
is-child[Optional] Specifies whether the incident record has a parent incident assigned. Valid values - true, false
root-cause[Optional] Root cause associated with the incident record. Valid values - Please refer to "Administration" section of the Service Desk application for complete list of supported values. Note: Any customization(including new values) done to the default list are also supported.
sla-violation[Optional] Specifies whether the incident record has sla violation. Valid values - true, false
is-template[Optional] Specifies whether the incident record is a template. Valid values - true, false
number-of-records[Optional] Specifies the number of records to be retrieved. Default value = -1 (Retrieves all the records) Valid values - Number greater than 0. In any case a maximum of 250 records will be retrieved.
additional-search-arguments[Optional] Specifies the custom search query involving one or more attributes. Valid value - Refer to "Service Desk Application" and "Technical Reference Guide" for valid search query syntax.

documentation.description: This wrapper retrieves incident records in the Service Desk system.
